translated: I was a sage at that time;
I gave garlic to the Community.
In the dispensation of Vipassī, the Bull of a Man,
I was devoted to the one who was free;
Having given garlic to the Community,
for an eon I rejoiced in heaven.
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of giving garlic.
I have done what the Buddha’s teaching requires.”

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā lasuṇadāyako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā lasuṇadāyakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: Thus the elder Lasuṇadāyaka recited these verses.
